sen.j: 預地（あずかりち/あずけち）とは、他者から預かって管理を委託された土地のこと。
sen.e: A person's Azukarichi indicates another person's land the management of which was entrusted to the person.
Azukarichi indicates the land a person has entrusted to another person to keep and manage.
sen.cmt: 読みやすくための修正
sen.e: "Azukarichi" (or "Azukechi") indicates the land a person has entrusted to another person to keep and manage.
sen.cmt: 統一リストその他（2009/6/29）の指示に従い、Azukarichi をダブルコーテーションで括りました。(or "Azukechi") を追記しました。

sen.j: 地割や惣作の際に生じた余剰地や地主が小作人に恩恵として無償もしくは軽負担で預けた土地、村が所有した林野（村持林野）などを預地と呼んだ。
sen.e: Originally, the following land space was called Azukarichi: the land space that still remained after an allocation of land space was made or after a Sosaku operation was performed, the land that the land owner entrusted as a favor to its kosakunin (tenant farmers) free of charge or with a small amount of charge, or the forest area owned by villages.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処惣作： 読みも、意味もはっきりできないまま、訳してあります。
sen.e: Originally, "Azukarachi" referred to shared land or land remaining after allocation had been made, to land that the land owner entrusted as a favor to its kosakunin (tenant farmers) free of charge (or for a small fee) or to forest area land owned by villages.
sen.cmt: 翻訳者の「惣作」をSosaku operationで表現するよりYahoo 国語辞書によると「惣作」は"江戸時代、耕作者のいない田畑を、村や組などの共同所持として耕作し、年貢を負担すること”を参考にして、”Shared land"で訳しなおした。
sen.e: Originally, "azukarichi" referred to shared land or land remaining after allocation had been made, to land that the land owner entrusted as a favor to its kosakunin (tenant farmers) free of charge (or for a small fee) or to forest area land owned by villages.
sen.cmt: Azukarachi を azukarichi に修正しました。※google books で検索すると、azukarichi という定訳は見つかりますが、Azukarichi は見つかりません。http://www.google.com/search?hl=ja&tbo=1&tbs=bks%3A1&q=azukarichi&btnG=%E6%A4%9C%E7%B4%A2&aq=f&aqi=&aql=&oq=&gs_rfai=

sen.j: しかしながら、もっとも知られているものは江戸幕府の直轄地（天領）を大名・旗本・幕府の遠国奉行らに預けて統治を代行させた土地を指す（「預所」とも）。
sen.e: However, the most famous one was the land that was in the direct territories of the Edo bafuku (called Tenryo) but whose control was actually entrusted to Daimyo, Hatamoto, or ongoku-bugyo (Edo bakufu government officers placed outside Edo) (also called Azukari-dokoro).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, it was more commonly used to refer to land that was in the direct territories of the Edo bafuku (called Tenryo) but whose control was actually entrusted to Daimyo (feudal lords), Hatamoto (direct retainers of the bakufu) or ongoku-bugyo (Edo bakufu government officers placed outside Edo), who were otherwise called Azukari-dokoro.
sen.cmt: 読みやすくためなどの修正
sen.e: However, it was more commonly used to refer to land that was in the direct territories of the Edo bafuku (called Tenryo) but whose control was actually entrusted to Daimyo (feudal lords), Hatamoto (direct retainers of the bakufu) or ongoku-bugyo (Edo bakufu government officers placed outside Edo), who were otherwise called Azukari-dokoro.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 元は戦国大名や豊臣政権が採用した蔵入地の制度を江戸幕府が継承した。
sen.e: This was originated in the system called Kurairi that was employed by Sengoku daimyo (daimyo in the Sengoku period) and the Toyotomi government, and the Edo bakufu adopted the system as well.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This was derived from a system called Kurairi that was employed by Sengoku daimyo (daimyo in the Sengoku period) and the Toyotomi government and also adopted by the Edo bakufu.
sen.cmt: 言葉の結び付けが間違っています。
sen.e: This was derived from the kurairichi (lands under direct rule of the shogun or daimyo) system that was employed by Sengoku daimyo (daimyo in the Sengoku period) and the Toyotomi government and also adopted by the Edo bakufu.
sen.cmt: 「蔵入地の制度」a system called Kurairi を the kurairichi (lands under direct rule of the shogun or daimyo) system に修正しました。

sen.j: 関ヶ原の戦い以後に獲得した幕府領を預地として大名らに預けて代わりに統治を行わせ、幕府はその年貢収入を獲得していた。
sen.e: Then the bakufu entrusted the bakufu territories gained after the Battle of Sekigahara to daimyo and others as Azukarichi, and made the entrusted land governed by them, gaining taxes from there.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Then the bakufu entrusted as Azukarichi the bakufu territories gained after the Battle of Sekigahara to Daimyo who were made to govern instead, and the bakufu gained the land tax income.
sen.cmt: 読みやすくためなどの修正
sen.e: Then the bakufu entrusted as Azukarichi the bakufu territories gained after the Battle of Sekigahara to Daimyo who were made to govern instead, and the bakufu gained the land tax income.
sen.cmt: Azukarichi を azukarichi に修正しました。Daimyo を daimyo (feudal lords) に修正しました。

sen.j: 預地は3-5年位の期間であるが、期限を定めない場合もある。
sen.e: Azukarichi was entrusted for three to five years, but there was also Azukarichi for which no such period for entrustment was determined
The land was entrusted for three to five years, but there were also cases of Azukarichi where the period for entrustment was unspecified.
sen.cmt: 読みやすくためなどの修正
sen.e: The land was entrusted for three to five years, but there were also cases of Azukarichi where the period for entrustment was unspecified.
sen.cmt: Azukarichi を azukarichi に修正しました。

sen.j: 統治自体は委託された藩の仕置に任されており、徴税した年貢の一部を口米・口永などの名目で手数料として藩に与えられた他は主要地にある幕府の米蔵に納められた。
sen.e: The operation to govern the land itself was entrusted to the domain concerned, and nengu (land tax) rice crop from the land was placed in a rice warehouse in a key area, after a portion of it was given to the domain with the name of Kuchimai or Kuchinaga (口永).
sen.cmt: 口永： 読み、意味ともに不明です。
sen.e: The operation to govern the land itself was entrusted to the clan, and nengu (land tax) rice crop from the land was placed in bakufu rice warehouses in key areas, after a portion of the yearly contribution was nominally given to clans such as Kuchimai or Kuchinaga.
sen.cmt: "a rice warehouse in a key area"を複数に変更などの修正
sen.e: The operation to govern the land itself was entrusted to the clan, and nengu (land tax) rice crop from the land was placed in bakufu rice warehouses in key areas, after a portion of the yearly contribution was nominally given to clans such as Kuchimai or Kuchinaga.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: ただし、幕府領の多くを占めた関東地方などでは大名による預地は設定されず、幕府代官による支配が行われた。
sen.e: However, in the areas where lots of bakufu territories were located, for example, in the Kanto region, Azukarichi was not entrusted to daimyo but controlled by daikan (bakufu government officers sent to those bakufu territories) of the bakufu in these areas.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, in the areas where lots of bakufu territories were located, such as the Kanto region, the land was not entrusted to daimyo (feudal lords) but rather controlled by the bakufu daikan (bakufu government officers sent to those bakufu territories) for those areas.
sen.cmt: 読みやすくためなどの修正
sen.e: However, in the areas where lots of bakufu territories were located, such as the Kanto region, the land was not entrusted to daimyo (feudal lords) but rather controlled by the bakufu daikan (bakufu government officers sent to those bakufu territories) for those areas.
sen.cmt: Azukarichi を azukarichi に修正しました。(feudal lords) 既出のため削除しました。

sen.j: 預地は江戸などの主要都市から離れた地方に集中していた。
sen.e: Azukarichi was concentrated in areas far from major cities.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Most of the land entrusted was in areas far from major cities such as Edo.
sen.cmt: 江戸などが訳しませんでした。
sen.e: Most of the land entrusted was in areas far from major cities such as Edo.
sen.cmt: of the land entrusted を azukarichi に修正しました。

sen.j: また、預けられた藩も親藩・譜代大名や金沢藩・安濃津藩などの幕府の信頼が厚い外様大名の大藩に限られていた。
sen.e: The domains where such land was entrusted were limited to Shinpan (the domains whose lords were a relative of the shogun family), fudai-daimyo (whose family was a retainer of the Tokugawa family from before the Battle of Sekigahara), big domains, such as the Kanazawa domain and the Anotsu domain, whose lords were tozama daimyo (who became a retainer of the Tokugawa family after the Battle of Sekigahara) but were deeply trusted by the bakufu.

The clans to whom such land was entrusted were limited to Shinpan (clans whose lords were a relative of the shogun family), fudai-daimyo (whose family was a retainer of the Tokugawa family from before the Battle of Sekigahara), and big clans such as the Kanazawa and Anotsu clans, (who became a retainer of the Tokugawa family after the Battle of Sekigahara) but were deeply trusted by the bakufu.
sen.cmt: 翻訳者が歴史に詳しいと仮定して、書き足した処をそのままに残しました。
sen.e: The clans to whom such land was entrusted were limited to Shinpan (clans whose lords were a relative of the shogun family), fudai-daimyo (whose family was a retainer of the Tokugawa family from before the Battle of Sekigahara), and fairly large clans of tozama daimyo (nonhereditary feudal lord), such as Kanazawa and Anotsu, who were deeply trusted by the bakufu.
sen.cmt: 「外様大名の大藩」big clans such as the Kanazawa and Anotsu clans, (who became a retainer of the Tokugawa family after the Battle of Sekigahara) but were deeply trusted by the bakufu の訳が不自然に感じられましたので、修正しました。

sen.j: 更に幕府は一貫して預所の増加を避け、出来る限り幕府代官を通じた支配への切替を目指しており、1713年（正徳 (日本)3年）には一旦全ての預所を廃止して代官支配地に切り替えている。
sen.e: Furthermore, the bakufu consistently avoided increasing the amount of Azuke-dokoro, aiming at switching to control through the daikan officers of the bakufu as far as possible, and once in 1713, abolished all of the Azukari-dokoro, switching the control of the area to that by daikan officers.

Furthermore, the bakufu consistently avoided increasing the number of custodians, aiming to switch control through the local governors of the bakufu as far as possible, and once, in 1713, abolished all of the custodians, switching the control of the area to that by local governors.
sen.cmt: ロマジ英語などを減らすことで読みやすさなどを向上しました。
sen.e: Furthermore, the bakufu consistently avoided increasing the number of custodians, aiming to switch control through the local governors of the bakufu as far as possible, and once, in 1713, abolished all of the custodians, switching the control of the area to that by local governors.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: だが、遠隔地の統治にまで代官の手が回らなかったために7年後に預地を復活させた。
sen.e: However, it was impossible to place a daikan in every remote area concerned, and therefore, the system of Azukarichi was restored in seven years after it.
However, because it was impossible to place a local governor in every remote area, the system of Azukarichi was restored seven years later.
sen.cmt: 直訳っぽくな訳した表現などを訳しなおした
sen.e: However, because it was impossible to place a local governor in every remote area, the system of Azukarichi was restored seven years later.
sen.cmt: Azukarichi を azukarichi に修正しました。

sen.j: それでも幕府領に占める預地の割合は全体の10-20％程度に抑制されていた。
sen.e: Even in such a situation, the ratio of Azukarichi to all bakufu territories was as small as 10% to 20%.
Even so, the ratio of Azukarichi in all bakufu territories was restricted to 10% to 20%.
sen.cmt: as small asは別な表現と思います。
sen.e: Even so, the ratio of Azukarichi in all bakufu territories was restricted to 10% to 20%.
sen.cmt: Azukarichi を azukarichi に修正しました。

sen.j: 例えば、宝暦7年（1757年）には、幕府領全体で442万石あったのに対し、預地は58万石であった。
sen.e: For example, in 1757, the amount of rice crop from all bakufu territories was 4.42 million koku (approx. 180 liters/koku), while that of the Azukarichi 580 thousand koku.
For example, in 1757, the amount of rice crop from all bakufu territories was 4.42 million koku (approx. 180 litres/koku), compared with 580,000 for the Azukarichi.
sen.cmt: 素敵な書き足すがありました。
sen.e: For example, in 1757, the amount of rice crop from all bakufu territories was 4.42 million koku (approx. 180 litres/koku), compared with 580,000 for the Azukarichi.
